title: Eurostar sets new passenger record
text:
Eurostar sets new passenger record 21 July 2015 Save 
Eurostar has set a new record having carried 2.8 million passengers in a single quarter. 
The number of passengers who used the service in Q2, 2015, represent a 3% year-on-year increase on the 2.7 million who used it in the same period in 2014. 
The increase in passenger numbers was partially down to a 10% year-on-year increase in Business Premier passengers. 
A new south of France service launched on May 1 has also sold well with more than 88,000 tickets sold so far. 
Despite the strong passenger numbers, sales for the second quarter rose by 1.5% to £232 million, not enough of a lift to reverse the hit sales took in Q1 2015 thanks to a combination of a lorry fire in the Eurotunnel and the Paris terrorist attacks. 
This means overall sales revenues for H1 2015 are down by 2% compared to 2014, although passenger numbers remain up at 5.1 million. 
However, it is hoped a new fleet of trains entering service later this year will boost the figures. 
Nicolas Petrovic, the chief executive of Eurostar, said: “Over the last three months we have carried more passengers than in any other quarter. 
“With demand for our services at an all-time high we are looking forward to the arrival of our new trains. 
“The combination of state-of-the-art design, unrivalled comfort and 20% extra seats means that we are well placed to meet the growing demand as passengers increasingly opt for high speed rail over plane.”
